pr_title: fix Hadoop ingestion fails due to error 'JavaScript is disabled' on certain config

timeline.message: fix Hadoop ingestion fails due to error 'JavaScript is disabled', if determine partition hadoop job is run

timeline.bodyText: injectDruidProperties has an almost same block with this. How about adding a new method HadoopDruidIndexerConfig.getAllowedProperties() which returns a map of a property name to a property? And this new method can be used both in injectDruidProperties() and this method.
timeline.author: jihoonson

timeline.bodyText: listOfAllowedPrefix seems to always be the allowedHadoopPrefix of this class. Can it be a non-static method?
timeline.author: jihoonson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -138,6 +138,20 @@
     ROWS_THROWN_AWAY_COUNTER
   }
 
+  public static Map<String, String> getAllowedProperties(List<String> listOfAllowedPrefix)

replies.bodyText: JobHelper.injectSystemProperties and JobHelper.injectDruidProperties methods are static. If we change those to non-static then yes, getAllowedProperties can be non-static since listOfAllowedPrefix are always allowedHadoopPrefix. But maybe leaving it like this is more flexible as the caller might pass something other than allowedHadoopPrefix for listOfAllowedPrefix
replies.author: maytasm

replies.bodyText: Leaving as is unless you have strong opinion on changing all those to non-static and having JobHelper instances. @jihoonson
replies.author: maytasm

replies.bodyText: I guess you can make this method non-static while keeping those methods as static if they accept HadoopDruidIndexerConfig instead of listOfAllowedPrefix?
replies.author: jihoonson
